snippet: Preliminary estimates indicate that 103 people were killed in the ambush — mostly women, children and elderly people unable to run away.
abstract: United Nations is sending fact-finding team to site of massacre in remote region of South Sudan where Murle ethnic group reportedly ambushed Lou Nuer villagers; preliminary estimates indicate that 103 people were killed--mostly women, children and elderly people unable to run away.
lead_paragraph: Preliminary estimates indicate that 103 people were killed in the ambush — mostly women, children and elderly people unable to run away.

headline.seo: U.N. Team to Visit Site of Massacre in South Sudan
headline.main: U.N. Fact-Finding Team to Visit Site of South Sudan Killings
headline.print_headline: U.N. Fact-Finding Team to Visit Site of South Sudan Killings

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
